conclusion: Determine the time \( t_1 \) it takes for the wooden rod to pass through the upper end \( A \) of the cylinder using kinematic equations.
The rod is released from rest and falls freely under the influence of gravity.
Use kinematic equations for uniformly accelerated motion to find the time.
Initial velocity (\( u \)) of the rod is \( 0 \, \mathrm{m/s} \).
Acceleration due to gravity (\( g \)) is \( 10 \, \mathrm{m/s}^2 \).
Distance from the suspension point to the upper end of the cylinder (\( s \)) is \( 20 \, \mathrm{m} \).
Use the kinematic equation \( s = ut +  rac{1}{2}gt^2 \).
Plug in the known values: \( 20 = 0 \cdot t +  rac{1}{2} \cdot 10 \cdot t^2 \).
Divide both sides by 5 to get \( t^2 = 4 \).
Take the square root of both sides to find \( t = \sqrt{4} = 2 \).
The time \( t_1 \) it takes for the wooden rod to pass through the upper end \( A \) of the cylinder is \( 2 \, \mathrm{s} \).
